member.name: T:Fusee.Serialization.FusContents
member.summary: Polymorphic contents of a fus file. The actual contents is contained in a sub-class. Possible sub-classes are listed in decorators preceding this class declaration. This mechanism allows fus files to contain different types of contents as well as different versions of contents.

member.name: T:Fusee.Serialization.FusFile
member.summary: De-serialized raw contents of a .fus File. Contains a and a very polymorphic .

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.FusFile.Header
member.summary: The file header. Contains some meta data.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.FusFile.Contents
member.summary: The file contents. Check and cast to the concrete type to access it, e. g. using a C# 7.0 pattern matching in switch expression.

summary.para: The classes in this module are the building blocks for storing FUSEE's scene graph file contents.
All classes and their properties are decorated with Protobuf.net attributes to mark them as serializable in the Google Protobuf binary format.
Serialized FUSEE scene graphs are stored in *.fus files.

In Addition Protobuf.net's Serializer class can generate a .proto schema from the attributed C# classes. This .proto schema can then be used to generate serializer/deserializer code for different languages. This is how the Blender .fus exporter Add-In implemented in python serializes into the .fus format.

The three main building block types for scene graphs are
Root object of each .fus file. Contains a file header and a list of root nodes.
Instances of this type (called nodes) make up the hierarchy of objects. Each node contains a list of child nodes and a list of components.
Instances of this type (called components) store the scene's payload. Various component types (inherited from ) exist to keep the different components a scene is made of.

member.name: T:Fusee.Serialization.V1.LerpType
member.summary: Symbolic value describing the type of Lerp (linear interpolation) to perform.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.LerpType.Lerp
member.summary: Standard interpolation. Multi-Value-Types are interpolated individually for each value (e.g., x, y, z).

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.LerpType.Slerp
member.summary: Spherical interpolation. float3 are interpreted as Euler angles and interpolated in a shortest-path way using s.

member.summary: If set to false, the color bit won't be cleared before this camera is rendered.

member.summary: If set to false, the depth bit won't be cleared before this camera is rendered.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusCamera.Layer
member.summary: If there is more than one CameraComponent in one scene, the rendered output of the camera with a higher layer will be drawn above the output of a camera with a lower layer.

member.summary: The background color for this camera's viewport.

member.summary: You can choose from a set of projection methods. This will automatically calculate the correct projection matrix.

member.summary: The vertical (y) field of view in radians.

member.summary: Distance to the near and far clipping planes.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusCamera.Viewport
member.summary: The viewport in percent [0, 100]. x: start y: end z: width w: height

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusCamera.Active
member.summary: A camera is active by default. Set this to false to deactivate it.

member.name: T:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight
member.summary: Contains light information. If contained in a node, the node serves as a light object. If possible, avoid adding or removing these at runtime, instead create all you need and set active or inactive. The Position and Direction of a Light gets calculated internally, depending on the parent transform components, found in the scene graph.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.Active
member.summary: Represents the light status.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.Color
member.summary: Represents the color.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.MaxDistance
member.summary: Represents the attenuation of the light.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.Strength
member.summary: Represents the strength of the light (non-physically representation of the brightness). Should be a value between 0 and 1.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.Type
member.summary: Represents the type of the light.

member.summary: Represents the outer spot angle of the light.

member.name: F:Fusee.Serialization.V1.FusLight.Bias
member.summary: Bias for calculating shadows.
